New Records: Andries Gous now leading run-scorer in tournament after making unbeaten 80
Key Match Events: USA recovered from 76-5 to need 28 off last two overs but fall short
Quinton de Kock made 74, including 26-ball half-century
Gous and Harmeet Singh's partnership of 91 from 42 balls was broken
Kagiso Rabada took 3-18 and broke a big partnership for the USA
Shamsi had good figures up until this point but was hit for consecutive sixes by Harmeet
Rabada finishes with figures of 3-18 and seals the game for South Africa
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa captain Aiden Markram: 'Hopefully we can tidy up a few things and the win looks a little bit more comprehensive.'
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Aaron Jones: 'I don't want to say disappointed, but yeah it's hard to take the defeat after getting so close.'
Man of the match, South Africa's Quinton de Kock: 'It is nice getting out on an easier wicket finally.'
Katherine Sciver-Brunt: 'The fight and energy of the USA is great, their story throughout this tournament has been inspiring.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa post 194-4 with Quinton de Kock making 74
Andries Gous walks off having carried his bat for 80 off 47
Saurabh Netravalkar pick of USA bowlers with 2-21
Rabada was the pick of their bowlers with 3-18
